On 9/19/05, John H. E. <johnemb@...> wrote:

> No, TestNG is just a test harness, like JUnit.
>
> I'm guessing you could always use junit.jar on a J2ME CDC device... But
> are there any reasons why using the Junit framework/harness on a J2ME CDC
> platform/configuration would not work? Anyone?


First of all, there is no reflection on a CDC device, so that's not an
option. There is J2MEUnit, which addresses that, but I will argue that
testing on the device is not what is needed.

I would already be very happy to be able to run all these tests on an
emulator (even running Java SE). I would argue that such testing would catch
easily 95% of the regressions. Of course, you are still left with a small
percentage of tests that will pass on the emulator and fail on the real
device, and this needs to be addressed separately.

But having a JME emulator that can be drivent programmatically from Java
would be a huge boost for JME testing.


--
Cedric
